snippet: In a new memoir, Leon E. Panetta draws a largely respectful portrait of a president who follows a “well-reasoned vision for the country” but also “misses opportunities.”
lead_paragraph: In a new memoir, Leon E. Panetta draws a largely respectful portrait of a president who follows a “well-reasoned vision for the country” but also “misses opportunities.”
abstract: Leon Panetta book Worthy Fights: A Memoir of Leadership in War and Peace offers blunt account of his time in the Obama administration; Panetta draws largely respectful portrait of Pres Obama, but is critical of some of Obama's decisions.

headline.main: In Book, Panetta Recounts Frustration With Obama
headline.print_headline: In Book, Panetta Recounts Frustration With Obama

snippet: The Pentagon said it had hit Islamic State targets in an area that has been subject to a weeklong onslaught by the militants, action that appeared to open a new front for American airstrikes in Syria.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon said it had hit Islamic State targets in an area that has been subject to a weeklong onslaught by the militants, action that appeared to open a new front for American airstrikes in Syria.
abstract: Pentagon reports it has conducted its first strikes against Islamic State targets in besieged Kurdish area of Syria along the Turkish border that has been subject to weeklong onslaught by the militants.

snippet: The president says he won’t send troops. But war has its own logic.
lead_paragraph: The president says he won’t send troops. But war has its own logic.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Fredrik Logevall and author Gordon M Goldstein questions whether Pres Obama will allow America to be drawn into situation in Iraq and Syria similar to country's involvement in Vietnam; compares initial reluctance and political pressures faced by Pres Lyndon Johnson to those encountered by Obama; holds that Obama's gloomy realism may not save him from ill-advised military action, particularly once he has started down slippery slope of intervention.

headline.main: Will Syria Be Obama’s Vietnam?

snippet: Airstrikes, conducted with several Arab allies, unleashed a torrent of cruise missiles and precision-guided bombs on the militants’ de facto capital, Raqqa, Syria.
lead_paragraph: Airstrikes, conducted with several Arab allies, unleashed a torrent of cruise missiles and precision-guided bombs on the militants’ de facto capital, Raqqa, Syria.
abstract: United States and several Arab allies launch airstrikes against Islamic State and other militants in Syria; unleash torrent of cruise missiles and precision-guided bombs from air and sea on militants' de facto capital Raqqa and along porous Iraq border; strikes represent major turning point in Pres Obama's war against Sunni militants and open up risky new stage of American military campaign.

headline.main: Airstrikes by U.S. and Allies Hit ISIS Targets in Syria
headline.sub: Bombs From Air and Sea Target Militants' Stronghold
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Allies Strike Sunni Militants in Syria

snippet: The president of Turkey is weakening the fight against the Islamic State by engaging in cynical political calculations.
lead_paragraph: The president of Turkey is weakening the fight against the Islamic State by engaging in cynical political calculations.
abstract: Editorial condemns Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan for failing to take action against Islamic State extremists besieging town of Kobani, Syria, and its Kurdish population; holds by remaining passive, Erdogan is seeking to weaken Kurds and force United States to help him oust Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad; contends Erdogan thus is enabling Islamic State extremists, enraging Kurds in Turkey and threatening 50-plus-nation coalition United States has assembled.

headline.seo: Turkey’s Refusal to Fight ISIS Hurts the Kurds
headline.main: Mr. Erdogan’s Dangerous Game

snippet: The Obama administration tried to convey a resolute coalition, but the vast majority of attacks were by American warplanes.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration tried to convey a resolute coalition, but the vast majority of attacks were by American warplanes.
abstract: Military officials describe successful beginning to offensive against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, noting that majority of airstrikes in Syria have been carried out by American forces; account comes after Obama administration had tried to convey a resolute coalition with Middle Eastern nations in the region.

headline.main: U.S. Is Carrying Out Vast Majority of Strikes on ISIS, Military Officials Say
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Carrying Out Vast Majority of Strikes on ISIS, Military Officials Say

snippet: Maisa Saleh, who hosted a weekly talk show in Damascus wearing a wig and using an alias to conceal her identity, has gone public with her story.
lead_paragraph: Maisa Saleh, who hosted a weekly talk show in Damascus wearing a wig and using an alias to conceal her identity, has gone public with her story.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Maisa Saleh, Syrian journalist in exile in Turkey who has gone public with her story after hosting weekly talk show in Damascus wearing a disguise and using an alias to conceal her identity; Saleh has received 2014 Anna Politkovskaya Award for investigative journalism that earned her an arrest and imprisonment.

headline.main: A Chronicler of Syria’s Conflict Returns to the Spotlight, Minus a Disguise
headline.print_headline: A Chronicler of Syria’s Conflict Returns to the Spotlight, Minus a Disguise
